pageContext.claim: “Last year, 565 people were murdered in Chicago. Since Eddie Johnson has been police chief, more than 1,500 people have been murdered in Chicago, and 13,067 people have been shot. During the first weekend of August 2019, 7 people were murdered and 52 were wounded in 32 shootings in Chicago. And recently, they had 78 shootings over a weekend spree, and 3 people killed. And Chicago has the toughest gun laws in the United States.”
pageContext.analysis: Chicago has a high rate of shootings relative to other major cities, but Trump is cherry-picking the worst possible numbers to attack the city's police superintendent, who was brought in amid high crime rates. Murders have been declining in Chicago in recent years.
